div.h2: Vaccination Protocol Dose Status Reason codes
div.p: This code system http://www.fhir.org/guides/ig-template/CodeSystem/doseStatusReason-codes defines the following codes:

tr.td: Vaccine Dose Administered was administered after the Lot Number Expiration Date.
Vaccine Dose Administered was deemed to be ineffective or sub-potent. (e.g. recalled, cold-chain break, partially administered).
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered at too young of an age.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered too soon following a previous dose.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered too close to another vaccine (e.g. live virus conflict).
Vaccine Dose Administered amount was less than the recommended amount.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered outside of an acceptable age range

name.value: Vaccination Protocol Dose Status Reason codes

definition.value: Vaccine Dose Administered was administered after the Lot Number Expiration Date.
Vaccine Dose Administered was deemed to be ineffective or sub-potent. (e.g. recalled, cold-chain break, partially administered).
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered at too young of an age.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered too soon following a previous dose.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered too close to another vaccine (e.g. live virus conflict).
Vaccine Dose Administered amount was less than the recommended amount.
Vaccine Dose Administered was administered outside of an acceptable age range
